Google's Eric Schmidt Sees "Bubble" Google has made 87 acquisitions worth$ 8.4 billion in the last 10 years, but the recent high valuations placed on some high-profile Internet companies has Eric Schmidt scratching his head. There are clear signs of a bubble, Mr. Eric Schmidt told the Swiss magazine Bilanz. "But valuations are what they are." , Google's chief executive Eric Schmidt rejected the notion that Google was losing key people. "Our retention has been actually the same and our turnover has been exactly the same for seven years," he said. We're going to be hiring many thousands of people this year. Mr Eric Schmidt , speaking at the DLD media conference in Munich yesterday, said he expected to spend another 10 years at the company, after his surprise handover last week to co-founder Larry Page.
